description: This is the base interface that all Request implements.

id.description: The unique immutable ID for this request. A new ID will be generated for new Request. Once issued, this ID is guaranteed to never change or be re-issued.

accessRequirementId.description: The ID of the Access Requirement which requires a request to be submitted to gain access to a dataset. This request contains information that satisfies those requirements.

researchProjectId.description: The ID of the research project associated with this request.

createdOn.description: The date this request was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date this request was last modified.

createdBy.description: The ID of the user that created this request.

modifiedBy.description: The ID of the user that last modified this request.

ducFileHandleId.description: The Data Use Certificate uploaded by user.

irbFileHandleId.description: The Institutional Review Board Approval document uploaded by user.

attachments.description: The set of file handle ID of attached files to this request.

accessors.description: The set of user ID who will gain access to the data set once the request is approved.

etag.description: Synapse employs an Optimistic Concurrency Control (OCC) scheme to handle concurrent updates. Since the E-Tag changes every time a request is updated it is used to detect when a client's current representation of a request is out-of-date.

concreteType.description: Indicates which implementation of RequestInterface this object represents.
